column9: As an OB/GYN expecting a child, I highly recommend these vitamins.  They are easy to take and have all important DHA which is important for fetal brain development. column2: Hopeful!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just began taking this prenatal vitamin recently, as my hubby and I are beginning to plan a family.  I was encouraged to take it before bed, as I have had numerous difficulty with taking vitamins of any sort in the past.  So far, so good.  I have to say I am suprised . . . thankful, but suprised.  :-)  And , in response to the other comments on here about the fishy taste/smell . . . column2: EvasMommy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had both good and horrible days with this vitamin.  I have discovered that you truly need to have a completely empty stomach to not get those disgusting fishy burps.  They are so bad for me if I have anything at all in my stomach, but if I'm totally empty and haven't eaten for a few hours, it's fine with NO side effects.  I can't believe it can be so horrible with food in your stomach and just fine with an empty stomach.  I recommend to anyone to truly take it between meals, more toward your next meal than your last one and if you're like me you should have no problem.

column2: Regina, AL , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am not pregnant nor planning a pregnancy while taking Tandem, however, I am a post GASTRIC BYPASS patient with a extreme low iron deficiency...So far I have been taking this medication for approximately 6 months and I have found it easier on me that normal iron supplements as I do not experience the usual constipation that most iron supplements produce.   It has been a great experience. Regina, AL

column2: Macy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the easiest prenatal vitamin that I have ever taken.
